Comment.Language: The Greek hymn "The Procession of Judas (Ioudac O Paranomoc)" is chanted while the deacons are going â€œbackwardsâ€? (clockwise) around an empty chair, symbolizing the Judasâ€™ empty bishopric. Some rites call for placing an upside-down chair, symbolizing the broken law. This hymn is for Judasâ€™ reprimand:

Text.Language: With silver, you have sold Christ to the Jews, who have broken the law.

The law breakers took Christ and nailed Him on the Cross at the place of Cranium.

Barabban ton kata kriton a~pelucan auton ton k~rit/n: ke decpot/n ectaurwca: Ic t/n n~leuran lon,/n e~pi ye~nt/c: ke wc l/ct/n xulw p~roc/~lwcan e~y/kan: en m~n/miw~ o~ ektou tavou e~girac ton Lazaron:

Barabbas the condemned thief was set free and the Master, the Judge they crucified. They thrust a spear in Your side, and as a thief they nailed You on the Cross. They laid You in a tomb, O You, who raised Lazarus from the tomb.

Truly He rose but the soldiers were not aware that truly the Savior of the world has risen. He who suffered and died for our sake, O Lord, glory be to You. Amen.
